baseline_groups.claim_summary: Minority-name hosts face a price penalty on Airbnb, indicating ethnic discrimination in peer-to-peer rental markets.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 2 has 4 columns with increasing controls/FE. Col 1: citywave FE only (coef=-0.169, p<0.001). Col 2: + property controls (coef=-0.111). Col 3: + block FE (coef=-0.068). Col 4: + block FE + controls (coef=-0.034). All highly significant. The discrimination effect ranges from 3.4% to 16.9% depending on controls.

global_notes: Paper studies ethnic discrimination on Airbnb using host name ethnicity. 77 total specs. 97% significant at 5%. The negative coefficient (minority price penalty) is extremely robust across all specification choices. Only 1 out of 77 specs shows a positive coefficient. City-level clustering weakens but does not eliminate significance.
